perturbation.original_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a month to month basis until terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other setting forth the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a month to month basis until terminated by either party upon ten (10) days prior written notice to the other setting forth the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.explanation: In Texas, for certain commercial agreements, a 30-day notice period is considered a standard reasonable timeframe. Reducing the notice period to 10 days may be deemed unreasonable and could lead to legal challenges, conflicting with general contract law principles requiring reasonable notice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles - Reasonableness of Notice

perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor agrees to indemnify and defend EDGE from and against any lien claims and to discharge any lien or furnish an indemnity bond equal to the lien amount (or any greater amount required by law) within ten (10) days notice from EDGE of the presence of any lien.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor agrees to indemnify and defend EDGE from and against any lien claims and to discharge any lien or furnish an indemnity bond equal to the lien amount (or any greater amount required by law) within two (2) days notice from EDGE of the presence of any lien.
perturbation.explanation: Texas law provides specific timelines for addressing mechanic's liens. Requiring a subcontractor to discharge a lien or furnish an indemnity bond within two days may be an unreasonably short timeframe, potentially conflicting with their legal rights and ability to adequately respond to the lien claim, thus creating a legal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
EDGE may terminate this Agreement, or any one or more awarded Purchase Orders and take control of the Work for such terminated Purchase Orders, including any or all materials for the Work, and may proceed with the completion of the Work as contemplated by this Agreement by whatever method deemed expedient by EDGE upon the occurrence of any of the following events, which shall be deemed events of a default by Subcontractor hereunder:

4) Any Lower-tier Subcontractor files a (i) notice of intention to file a construction or mechanic's lien, (ii) mechanic's lien, or (iii) construction lien, and such filing is not removed by Subcontractor within three (3) days after the period required by this Agreement;
perturbation.changed_text:
EDGE may terminate this Agreement, or any one or more awarded Purchase Orders and take control of the Work for such terminated Purchase Orders, including any or all materials for the Work, and may proceed with the completion of the Work as contemplated by this Agreement by whatever method deemed expedient by EDGE upon the occurrence of any of the following events, which shall be deemed events of a default by Subcontractor hereunder:

4) Any Lower-tier Subcontractor files a (i) notice of intention to file a construction or mechanic's lien, (ii) mechanic's lien, or (iii) construction lien, and such filing is not removed by Subcontractor within one (1) days after the period required by this Agreement;
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time for a Subcontractor to remove the filing after the original period to one day, creates an unreasonable burden on the Subcontractor that the filing is not removed. This is not enough time and would create a legal challenge because it conflicts with the Subcontractor's right to defense.
